page.title: 04INSHORE RESCUE BOAT
page.content: The{Ryde Lifeguards}patrol the 7km of coastal waters from East Cowes to Nettlestone Point. This is one of 5 Inshore Rescue Services on the Island. The{boats}used are a 5.5m fibreglass Dory, a 4m Avon Searider and a 3m Commando swimming support boat. The station is{manned}by 18 qualified lifeguards, 10 auxillaries and 8 cadets. There are{watches} weekends,evenings and school holidays. Men are on call all the time. In{1984, assistance was given}to 14 yachts,6 cabin cruisers,6 speedboats,3 windsurfers,1 fishing boat,1 canoe and a naval whaler.{Causes of difficulty} included capsizing ,running aground on Ryde Sands, damage from collision or fire and engine trouble.{Shoreline{ {patrols}were involved in numerous incidents involving swimmers and bathers.
